content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    questions = findall(md, "# Question\n")
    answers = findall(md, "# Answer\n")
    
    question_texts = [substr(md, start(q) + 7, end(q)) for q in questions]
    answer_texts = [substr(md, start(a) + 7, end(a)) for a in answers]
    
    questions = map(question -> strip(question, '\n'), question_texts)
    answers = map(answer -> strip(answer, ' '), answer_texts)
    
    return zip(questions, answers)
end
```

This function will find all sections starting with `# Question` and `# Answer` in the provided markdown text `md`. It strips leading spaces and newlines from the extracted question and answer texts, and returns a tuple of the form `(question, answer)` for each matching section.
